docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This property will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members.currentMember.getMember()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members/currentmember/getmember).
description: Gets the member's ID.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this property is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members.currentMember.getMember()`](wix-members/currentmember/getMember).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsers`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsers` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsers.currentUser`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getMember()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getMember()`
>    call and response properties.
>    The ID property is in the returned member object as `_id`.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The unique ID of the user.
> **Notes:**
> + The APIs in `wix-users` are only partially functional when previewing your site.
>   View a published version of your site to see their complete functionality.
> + The APIs in `wix-users` can only be used once the page has loaded. Therefore,
>   you must use them in code that is contained in or is called from the
>   [onReady()]($w.html#onReady) event handler or any element event handler.

examples.title: Get the current member's information

let expiryDate = firstPlan.expiryDate;  // Thu Nov 29 2018 08:39:41 GMT-0400 (Eastern Daylight Time)

extra.description: This example uses a deprecated object.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This property will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members.currentMember.getMember()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members/currentmember/getmember).
description: Indicates whether the member is logged in or not.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this property is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members.currentMember.getMember()`](wix-members/currentmember/getMember).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsers`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsers` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsers.currentUser`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getMember()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getMember()`
>    call and response properties.
>    - If a member is logged in, the member object is returned.
>    - If no member is logged in, a response of undefined is returned.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
Gets one of the following:
+ `true` — The user is logged in.
+ `false` — The user is not logged in.
> **Notes:**
> + The APIs in `wix-users` are only partially functional when previewing your site.
>   View a published version of your site to see their complete functionality.
> + The APIs in `wix-users` can only be used once the page has loaded. Therefore,
>   you must use them in code that is contained in or is called from the
>   [onReady()]($w.html#onReady) event handler or any element event handler.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This property will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members.currentMember.getRoles()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members/currentmember/getroles).
description: Gets the member's role.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this property is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members.currentMember.getRoles()`](wix-members/currentmember/getRoles).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsers`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsers` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsers.currentUser`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getRoles()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getRoles()`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
This property has been deprecated. Use the [`getRoles()`](#getRoles) function instead.
Gets one of the following roles:
+ `"Admin"` — The owner of the site.
+ `"Member"` — A user who is logged in.
+ `"Visitor"` — A user who is not logged in.
> **Notes:**
> + The APIs in `wix-users` are only partially functional when previewing your site.
>   View a published version of your site to see their complete functionality.
> + The APIs in `wix-users` can only be used once the page has loaded. Therefore,
>   you must use them in code that is contained in or is called from the
>   [onReady()]($w.html#onReady) event handler or any element event handler.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The email address of the user that is logged in.
Rejected - Message containing error that the current user is not logged in.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members.currentMember.getMember()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members/currentmember/getmember).
description: Gets the email of the current member.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members.currentMember.getMember()`](wix-members/currentmember/getMember).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsers`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsers` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsers.currentUser`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getMember()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getMember()`
>    call and response properties.
>    To return emails, you must specify the `"FULL"` fieldset.
>    The login email property is in the returned member object as `loginEmail`. If the member has any additional emails, they are in the `contactDetails.emails` array.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `getEmail()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the email address
of the user that is logged in or rejects if the current user is not logged in.
> **Notes:**
> + The APIs in `wix-users` are only partially functional when previewing your site.
>   View a published version of your site to see their complete functionality.
> + The APIs in `wix-users` can only be used once the page has loaded. Therefore,
>   you must use them in code that is contained in or is called from the
>   [onReady()]($w.html#onReady) event handler or any element event handler.

ret.doc:

Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary: Gets the user's member pricing plan.
description: The `getPricingPlans()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the
[pricing plans](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-and-setting-up-the-paid-plans-app)
of the user that is logged in or rejects if the current user is not logged in.
[Pricing plans](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-and-setting-up-the-paid-plans-app)
help you manage which site members can access which pages.
> **Notes:**
> + The APIs in `wix-users` are only partially functional when previewing your site.
>   View a published version of your site to see their complete functionality.
> + The APIs in `wix-users` can only be used once the page has loaded. Therefore,
>   you must use them in code that is contained in or is called from the
>   [onReady()]($w.html#onReady) event handler or any element event handler.

ret.doc:
Fulfilled - The user's roles.
Rejected - Error message.

docs.summary:
**Deprecated.**
This function will continue to work, but a newer version is available at
[wix-members.currentMember.getRoles()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-members/currentmember/getroles).
description: Gets the member's roles.
> #### Migration Instructions
> If this function is already in your code, it will continue to work.
> To stay compatible with future changes, migrate to
> [`wix-members.currentMember.getRoles()`](wix-members/currentmember/getRoles).
> To migrate to the new function:
> 1. Add the new import statement:
>    ```javascript
>    import { currentMember } from 'wix-members'
> 2. If you plan to migrate all functions that use `wixUsers`,
>    remove the original `import wixUsers` statement.
> 3. Look for any code that uses `wixUsers.currentUser`,
>    and replace it with `currentMember.getRoles()`.
>    Update your code to work with the new `getRoles()`
>    call and response properties.
> 4. Test your changes to make sure your code behaves as expected.
The `getRoles()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the [roles](https://support.wix.com/en/article/creating-member-roles-6943237) of
the user that is logged in or rejects if the current user is not logged in.
The following is returned when the user is:
+ A logged-in member: The promise resolves to the member's roles or an empty
array if the member has not been assigned any roles.
+ The site owner: The promise resolves to the admin's roles with an additional
role containing the `name` "Admin".
+ A non logged-in visitor: The Promise is rejected.
> **Notes:**
> + The APIs in `wix-users` are only partially functional when previewing your site.
>   View a published version of your site to see their complete functionality.
> + The APIs in `wix-users` can only be used once the page has loaded. Therefore,
>   you must use them in code that is contained in or is called from the
>   [onReady()]($w.html#onReady) event handler or any element event handler.

examples.title: Get a user's member roles
body: *   Logs: "No user is currently logged in"

members.name: name
members.doc: Role name as defined in the site's dashboard or one of "Admin" or "Member".

members.name: description
members.doc: Role description, if defined in the site's dashboard.

FAQs.title: How can I get the current user's name?
FAQs.markdown:
Use the [`currentUser`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-users.html#currentUser) property to get the current user's [`id`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-users.User.html#id). Then query the Members/PrivateMembersData collection for the item with that `_id`.

```javascript

wixData.query("Members/PrivateMembersData") \
  .eq("_id", wixUsers.currentUser.id) \
  .find() \
  .then( (results) => { \
    lastName = results.items[0].lastName; \
  } );

```

FAQs.title: How do I create a custom member registration form?
FAQs.markdown: Follow [this tutorial](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-code-tutorial-creating-a-custom-registration-form-with-code) to create a custom member registration form.

FAQs.title: How do I send an email to a user who is not the currently logged-in user?
FAQs.markdown: Using the [`emailUser()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-users.html#emailUser) function of [`wix-users`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-users.html) you can only send emails to the currently logged-in user. However, from the backend, using the [`emailUser()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-users-backend.html#emailUser) function of [`wix-users-backend`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-users-backend.html) you can send emails to any site member.
